00:00:13:030000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:00:13:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:13:030000.Dialogue: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone. Emergency preparedness drill.

00:00:16:030000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:00:16:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:26:020000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:00:26:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:26:020000.Dialogue: I have to get a lock for my door.

00:00:30:020000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:00:30:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:30:020000.Dialogue: I think you'll like the drill tonight. I've tried to make it fun. Each of these cards contains a detailed scenario of a possible apocalyptic event. Everything from wild fires to a surprise invasion by Canada.

00:00:44:040000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:00:44:040000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:47:190000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:00:47:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:47:190000.Dialogue: Sheldon, Canada is not going to invade California.

00:00:52:190000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:00:52:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:52:190000.Dialogue: Yeah, really? You think those hippies in Washington and Oregon can stop them?

00:00:58:030000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:00:58:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:00:220000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:00:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:00:220000.Dialogue: All righty! An 8.2 magnitude earthquake devastates Pasadena, reducing mighty edifices to dust, engulfing the city in flames. The streets flow with blood and echo with the cries of the wounded. Oh, excellent choice.

00:01:15:060000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:15:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:15:060000.Dialogue: Now, put on your hardhat and safety vest.

00:01:17:130000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:17:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:17:130000.Dialogue: Oh, fun. I get to spend another night in front of our apartment dressed like one of the Village People.

00:01:24:140000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:24:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:24:140000.Dialogue: You make that joke every three months. I still don't get it. Leonard... wait. What are you doing?

00:01:30:220000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:30:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:30:220000.Dialogue: I don't know, what am I doing?

00:01:33:120000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:33:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:33:120000.Dialogue: Look around you-- there's hypothetical broken glass everywhere. Really? You're going to face Armageddon without your orthotics? Your choice.

00:01:44:120000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:44:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:48:040000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:48:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:49:050000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
00:01:49:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:49:050000.Dialogue: And that's why we wear hardhats.

00:02:20:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:20:220000.Dialogue: Check it out-- press release from NASA.

00:02:24:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:24:060000.Dialogue: Um, Expedition 31 will launch this spring to the International Space Station. Crew members will include Commander Tom 'Tombo' Johnson, Astronaut Mike 'Supernova' Novacelik and Payload Specialist Howard Wolowitz.

00:02:38:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:38:070000.Dialogue: This is going right into my synagogue's newsletter.

00:02:43:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:43:140000.Dialogue: D-Dude, if you're going to be an astronaut, you need to pick a cool nickname.

00:02:47:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:47:060000.Dialogue: I don't get to pick it. The other guys have to give it to me.

00:02:49:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:49:200000.Dialogue: Oh. If I had one, it would be Brown Dynamite.

00:02:54:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:54:190000.Dialogue: Are you not listening to me? The other astronauts have to give you your nickname.

00:02:59:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:59:160000.Dialogue: Are you not looking at me? I am Brown Dynamite.

00:03:05:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:05:010000.Dialogue: Why do you put six sugars in your coffee?

00:03:07:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:07:230000.Dialogue: Because the cafeteria doesn't offer little packets of methamphetamine.

00:03:13:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:13:050000.Dialogue: Emergency drill night last night, huh?

00:03:17:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:17:010000.Dialogue: I'll tell you exactly how he did.

00:03:19:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:19:090000.Dialogue: Readiness: unsatisfactory. Follows direction: barely. Attitude: a little too much.

00:03:26:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:26:080000.Dialogue: Overall: not only will he probably die in a fiery inferno, his incessant whining would most certainly spoil everyone else's day.

00:03:37:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:37:070000.Dialogue: You know what, I can't even think straight. I'm going home. Will one of you guys give this nutbag a ride back later?

00:03:44:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:44:040000.Dialogue: You can't go home. You have to take me to the dentist at 4:00.

00:03:47:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:47:170000.Dialogue: Oh... can't you take the bus to the dentist?

00:03:50:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:50:040000.Dialogue: Of course I can. It's coming back, under the residual effects of the anesthesia, that's the problem. Two years ago, after a deep gum cleaning, I thought I got on a bus but somehow wound up on a booze cruise to Mexico.

00:04:03:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:03:180000.Dialogue: They put you under for a cleaning?

00:04:06:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:06:090000.Dialogue: Yeah, they have to-- I'm a biter.

00:04:08:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:08:220000.Dialogue: Whatever, Sheldon. I'm exhausted. I'm not taking you to the dentist.

00:04:12:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:12:230000.Dialogue: Wrong, sir. Wrong. Under section 37-B of the Roommate Agreement-- Miscellaneous Duties-- you are obligated to take me to the dentist. See? It's right here after providing a confirmation sniff on questionable dairy products.

00:04:27:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:27:070000.Dialogue: You know what, I am sick of the Roommate Agreement.

00:04:33:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:33:090000.Dialogue: It's ridiculous. I'm your roommate, not your chauffeur. You know, I had better things to do yesterday than drive you all the way to the good model train store in Garden Grove because the one in Pasadena has gotten too big for its britches.

00:04:52:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:52:120000.Dialogue: Hold on. Are you saying that you want to invoke Clause 209?

00:04:57:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:57:040000.Dialogue: I don't know what that is, but if it means I can go home and sleep, then yes.

00:05:01:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:01:030000.Dialogue: Think carefully here. Clause 209 suspends our friendship, and strips down the Roommate Agreement to its bare essentials. Our responsibilities toward each other would only be rent, utilities and a perfunctory chin jut of recognition as we pass in the hall. 'Sup?

00:05:40:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:40:140000.Dialogue: I'm gonna go home and take a nap.

00:05:41:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:41:210000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, tell it to someone who cares.

00:05:46:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:46:020000.Dialogue: I got pretty exciting NASA news today. Next week I fly to Houston for orientation and zero-gravity elimination drills.

00:05:55:120000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:55:120000.Dialogue: He's gonna learn to poop in space.

00:05:59:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:59:230000.Dialogue: Open the pod bay doors, HAL.

00:06:04:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:04:010000.Dialogue: Maybe your nickname should be Brown Dynamite.

00:06:10:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:10:070000.Dialogue: Hello, dear friends. And Dr. Hofstadter.

00:06:19:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:19:190000.Dialogue: My apologies. I would've been here sooner, but the bus kept stopping for other people to get on it.

00:06:28:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:28:100000.Dialogue: Oh, your concern for me is touching. It will serve you well when you take me to the dentist tomorrow.

00:06:34:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:34:090000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, Sheldon, I'm busy. I'm right in the middle of my addiction study. I've got a lab full of alcoholic monkeys, and tomorrow's the day we switch them to O'Doul's.

00:06:43:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:43:040000.Dialogue: You're my girlfriend and you're not going to cater to my every need? Oh, where'd the magic go?

00:06:51:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:51:010000.Dialogue: Sheldon, that's not what girlfriends are for. Although, you don't use them for what they're for, so what do I know?

00:07:03:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:03:010000.Dialogue: Howard doesn't make me do his shopping or take him to the dentist or pick up his dry cleaning, right?

00:07:08:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:08:160000.Dialogue: Absolutely. But when Ma's hips give out, you're up, kid.

00:07:14:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:14:010000.Dialogue: Well, if Amy's too busy, that gives the rest of you an opportunity to make my life easier, thus assuring yourselves a footnote in my memoirs, tentatively entitled You're Welcome, Mankind.

00:07:25:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:25:050000.Dialogue: All right, then, just shout when you hear the task you want to undertake. Uh, dentist.

00:07:34:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:34:220000.Dialogue: Okay, w-we can circle back to that one. Um, well, who wants to take me Wednesday morning to get new heels put on my dress shoes?

00:07:45:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:45:230000.Dialogue: Anyone? Oh. That one had hoot written all over it. Um, all right, uh, dermatologist. Allergist.

00:07:58:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:58:030000.Dialogue: Podiatrist. Supercuts? Okay, okay, here's a fun one. Um, I need a new picture frame and I have a hankering for Swedish meatballs. Who wants to spend the day with me at IKEA?

00:08:22:160000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:22:160000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, Sheldon. Can I help you find something today?

00:08:25:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:25:230000.Dialogue: No, no. I was just sitting at home thinking about how it might be nice to catch up with my ninth favorite person.

00:08:36:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:36:070000.Dialogue: My pen pal in Somalia was kidnapped by pirates.

00:08:43:080000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:43:080000.Dialogue: Uh... not so good. My shrink just killed himself and...

00:08:56:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:56:110000.Dialogue: So, what's new with your family? How's your mother? Is she alive?

00:09:05:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:05:210000.Dialogue: How about your grandparents, they alive?

00:09:09:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:09:210000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm so sorry for your loss.

00:09:12:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:12:130000.Dialogue: On a cheerier note, I have a teeth-cleaning appointment this afternoon. What do you say you take me over there, buddy boy?

00:09:21:010000.Speaker: Stuart
00:09:21:010000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, you want me to take you to the dentist?

00:09:23:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:23:200000.Dialogue: Yes. Now, I can't make any promises, but that's the sort of thing that gets a fella on the short list for the number eight friend slot.

00:09:32:040000.Speaker: Stuart
00:09:32:040000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm working. I can't take you to the dentist. Also-- and I can't stress this enough-- I don't want to take you to the dentist.

00:09:41:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:41:060000.Dialogue: Can't help a friend out in a time of need, huh? I see where your therapist was coming from.

00:09:55:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:55:230000.Dialogue: Ooh, ooh! What about we make your astronaut nickname Howard Buzz Wolowitz?

00:10:02:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:02:230000.Dialogue: You can't do Buzz. Buzz is taken.

00:10:11:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:11:090000.Dialogue: No, that's not what I'm talking about.

00:10:14:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:14:200000.Dialogue: Well, are you talking about when he thought he was real?

00:10:23:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:23:010000.Dialogue: Okay, um... how about Crash? Howard Crash Wolowitz.

00:10:28:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:28:130000.Dialogue: Yeah, terrific. The other astronauts would love to go hurtling through space with a guy named Crash.

00:10:33:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:33:150000.Dialogue: All right, um, how about... Oh, how about Rocket Man?

00:10:40:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:40:150000.Dialogue: That's not bad, Howard Rocket Man Wolowitz.

00:10:43:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:43:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's great, but I told you, I don't get to pick my nickname. It has to come from the other astronauts.

00:10:48:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:48:030000.Dialogue: Maybe there's a way to get them to come up with it.

00:10:52:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:52:120000.Dialogue: Once I tried carrying around a Duncan yo-yo, hoping the other kids would start calling me Duncan.

00:10:59:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:59:110000.Dialogue: No, they ended up calling me Sock Mouth.

00:11:03:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:03:130000.Dialogue: Because they took away my yo-yo and stuffed their socks in my mouth.

00:11:09:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:09:060000.Dialogue: Okay, uh, what if we make Rocket Man your ringtone, and the next time you talk to those guys, I'll call you and they'll hear it. Plant the seed.

00:11:18:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:18:190000.Dialogue: That's actually not a terrible plan.

00:11:20:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:20:160000.Dialogue: They don't call me Brown Dynamite for nothing.

00:11:29:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:29:230000.Dialogue: Hey, did you ever make it to the dentist?

00:11:31:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:31:200000.Dialogue: Not necessary. No. I found a service that'll send a van to your house for a teeth cleaning. Mostly they cater to dogs, but...

00:11:41:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:41:030000.Dialogue: ...the fellow on the phone seemed to have an open mind.

00:11:43:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:43:130000.Dialogue: All right, Sheldon, if you need me to take you to the dentist, I will take you to the dentist.

00:11:48:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:48:200000.Dialogue: Are you suggesting that you've come to your senses and wish to reestablish the mutual benefits that stem from full participation in the Roommate Agreement?

00:11:56:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:56:060000.Dialogue: Absolutely. If you admit that you're a 30-year-old man who's incapable of functioning on his own.

00:12:01:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:01:060000.Dialogue: Ooh, Sock Mouth's got him on the ropes.

00:12:06:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:06:020000.Dialogue: I will admit nothing of the sort. And now if you'll excuse me, I have to call my dentist and see if I can also get my hair shampooed and my nails clipped.

00:12:25:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:25:070000.Dialogue: Oh, good, your power's out, too.

00:12:28:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:28:130000.Dialogue: Because last month, I sent the electric company a Starbucks gift card, an apology note, and a few snapshots of me in a bra.

00:12:40:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:40:140000.Dialogue: What happened to all your glow- in-the-dark-emergency-exit stuff you had painted on the floor?

00:12:45:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:45:140000.Dialogue: Oh, that was wildly carcinogenic. Anyway... it's too bad you're no longer entitled to the full benefits of my friendship, because I happen to be extremely prepared for such an emergency. Please try not to see anything by this light. It's not for you.

00:13:02:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:02:230000.Dialogue: It's just a blackout; I'm sure the power will be back on soon.

00:13:05:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:05:160000.Dialogue: And I'm sure some fool in the Donner party said the snow would stop any day now.

00:13:11:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:11:030000.Dialogue: I like to think they ate him first.

00:13:14:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:14:160000.Dialogue: You know, I got some candles in my apartment.

00:13:16:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:16:120000.Dialogue: But candles?! During a blackout?! Are you mad? That's a fire hazard. No, Pasadena Water and Power recommends the far safer glow stick.

00:13:24:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:24:160000.Dialogue: You call that a glow stick?

00:13:37:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:37:040000.Dialogue: Before you go, consider this. Not only do I have a deep-cycle marine battery power source which is more than capable of running our entertainment system, I also have all 61 episodes of the BBC series Red Dwarf... and Fiddle-Faddle.

00:13:53:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:53:140000.Dialogue: All yours if you're willing to reinstate the Roommate Agreement.

00:13:57:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:57:230000.Dialogue: I've got wine at my place and some bubble wrap we could pop.

00:14:06:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:06:130000.Dialogue: Oh, he'll be back. Wine and a girl in the dark-- he's gonna be bored out of his mind.

00:14:16:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:16:230000.Dialogue: And to not having to watch Sheldon demonstrate his reverse osmosis machine that converts urine into drinking water.

00:14:26:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:26:050000.Dialogue: You know, in Girl Scouts, Tammie Dineesha said you could do that with panty hose. Boy, was she wrong.

00:14:33:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:33:090000.Dialogue: Anyway, you want to make out?

00:14:36:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:36:120000.Dialogue: I thought because our relationship's in a beta test, you wanted to take things slow.

00:14:41:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:41:200000.Dialogue: Okay. Do you want to make out slow?

00:14:45:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:45:220000.Dialogue: I can go so slow it'll be like there's a snail in your mouth.

00:14:56:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:56:150000.Dialogue: Well, lucky for you, there's nothing else to do right now.

00:15:03:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:03:030000.Dialogue: Since when don't you knock? It's like the only good thing about you.

00:15:06:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:06:150000.Dialogue: Social niceties have been suspended, Leonard. We're in a state of a emergency. The world has descended into darkened turmoil. Lawlessness and savagery are the order of the day.

00:15:22:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:22:010000.Dialogue: I wanted to alert you in case you smelled caramelizing marshmallows and thought a nearby candy factory was on fire.

00:15:29:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:29:220000.Dialogue: Yes, or good for us if you sign here and reinstate the full Roommate Agreement.

00:15:37:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:37:070000.Dialogue: Really? Huh! Okay. In that case, I will have a s'more by myself. And then I'm gonna have s'more.

00:15:57:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:57:080000.Dialogue: No, he's crazy. Sometimes crazy looks like sad so it'll suck you back in.

00:16:02:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:02:040000.Dialogue: I think he misses his little buddy.

00:16:07:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:07:120000.Dialogue: Fine. But mark my words, this frustrating, bogus teenage make-out session is not over.

00:16:24:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:24:030000.Dialogue: I thought you said candles were dangerous.

00:16:30:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:30:070000.Dialogue: I'm a scientist; I know what I'm doing. Oh, drat.

00:16:39:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:39:230000.Dialogue: Aww. It took me a gallon of urine to make that water.

00:16:48:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:48:090000.Dialogue: Listen, Sheldon, this is stupid. I don't see why we can't be friends. And I'm willing to drive you around and help you out with stuff. I just don't want to do it because of some silly Roommate Agreement.

00:16:59:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:59:080000.Dialogue: That we go back to the way things were. But when I do something for you, you show a little appreciation.

00:17:05:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:05:050000.Dialogue: And how would I do that?

00:17:16:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:16:000000.Dialogue: Counter-proposal. We reinstate the full Roommate Agreement with the following addendum: in the spirit of Mother's Day or Father's Day, once a year, we set aside a day to celebrate all your contributions to my life, both actual and imagined by you.

00:17:36:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:36:040000.Dialogue: We could call it Leonard's Day.

00:17:38:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:38:020000.Dialogue: I kind of like the sound of that.

00:17:43:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:43:010000.Dialogue: It's about you, like everything else. Oh, thank goodness. I don't think I had it in me to make another glass of water.

00:17:50:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:50:140000.Dialogue: So, do I get breakfast in bed on Leonard's Day?

00:17:54:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:54:150000.Dialogue: Can I sit in your spot?

00:18:00:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:00:180000.Dialogue: Of course you get a card.

00:18:06:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:06:040000.Dialogue: Hey, guys, the building manager said the reason the power went out is someone went down into the basement and just pulled the main breaker switch.

00:18:19:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:19:020000.Dialogue: Who do you think did that, Sheldon?

00:18:26:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:26:080000.Dialogue: But whoever that mystery man was, you should be eternally grateful, for without him, there would be no Leonard's Day.

00:18:36:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:36:060000.Dialogue: Oh, no pressure. Just get him a crummy card, you're good.

00:18:47:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:47:090000.Dialogue: All right, test my ring tone.

00:18:54:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:54:170000.Dialogue: That really is a good song.

00:19:04:070000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:19:04:070000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Howard, are you coming down for breakfast?!

00:19:06:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:06:180000.Dialogue: Ma, I told you I have a video conference with NASA! I said don't bother me!

00:19:11:040000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:19:11:040000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Oh! Listen to Mr. Big Shot Astronaut!

00:19:13:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:13:210000.Dialogue: Yes, please listen to Mr. Big Shot Astronaut!

00:19:24:100000.Speaker: NASA Guy
00:19:24:100000.Dialogue: Hey, Howard, thanks for getting up so early.

00:19:29:160000.Speaker: Dr Massimino
00:19:29:160000.Dialogue: The guys here call me Mass.

00:19:31:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:31:120000.Dialogue: Mass! That's a cool nickname. 'Cause force equals mass times acceleration.

00:19:36:050000.Speaker: Mass
00:19:36:050000.Dialogue: Yeah. It's just short for Massimino.

00:19:41:230000.Speaker: Mass
00:19:41:230000.Dialogue: Anyway, the plan for this morning is to go over the...

00:19:47:140000.Speaker: Mass
00:19:47:140000.Dialogue: What is that? Is that Rocket Man?

00:19:50:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:50:130000.Dialogue: Yeah, my ring tone. Kind of my favorite song, Rocket Man.

00:19:54:130000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:19:54:130000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Howard, your Fruit Loops are getting soggy!

00:20:03:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:03:180000.Dialogue: My mom. Sorry. No problem... Fruit Loops.
